title: Police: Couple made up ‘free sign’ story to get rid of dog in Attleboro
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News After reviewing security footage, the police determined their story was fabricated, and the couple admitted to lying, a local paper reported.
Attleboro Police Department A couple who claimed to have found a dog that had been abandoned in a cage on the side of a road last week made the story up, police told a local newspaper.
The couple left the dog with an employee in Seasons Corner Market in Attleboro just before 2 a.

title: Drake Maye paid tribute to former Patriots QB with his touchdown celebration
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I think he played the position in a different way than a lot of people do, and the guys around him rallied around him.
" Drake Maye finished with three total touchdowns on Sunday against the Panthers.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 28, 2025 | 7:51 PM 2 minutes to read Sunday was a homecoming of sorts for Patriots QB Drake Maye.

title: How the Patriots showed support for Terrell Williams amid cancer battle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I know Coach T liked that one.
" FOXBOROUGH – The phrase “T Strong” was etched in blue lettering against a background with the Patriots‘ logo placed above it and a ribbon replacing the “o” in strong.

The Patriots wore the phrase across their chests during pregame warmups, sporting the shirts to send a message of support to defensive coordinator Terrell Williams who was recently diagnosed with prostate cancer.

title: Ex-Boston police sergeant pleads not guilty to child rape in Suffolk Superior Court
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Paul Downey is accused of raping a 14-year-old boy after communicating over Snapchat to negotiate sex and payment.
Paul Downey stands with his back to the courtroom during his arraignment at Dorchester Municipal Court on June 30, 2025.
Boston25 ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Stefon Diggs’ breakout game fuels further hope for ascending Patriots offense
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He looked a little faster than I thought.
He looked pretty fast.
" Stefon Diggs recorded 101 received yards on Sunday against Carolina.

title: The key to the highest-scoring performance of the Drake Maye era? A functional offensive line.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I've probably played 100 games.
I can count on one hand the amount of games I've had like this.
" Drake Maye, Hunter Henry, and the Patriots' offensive line celebrates a touchdown against the Panthers.

title: Marcus Jones’ ‘ruthless’ record-breaking day gave Patriots spark they needed
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “Golly, it's fun seeing that.

title: 4 things to know as Red Sox secure No. 5 seed, earn matchup with Yankees in wild-card round starting Tuesday
author: Trevor Hass

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in blowout win vs. the Panthers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots In total, Marcus Jones tallied 167 punt return yards, setting a new single-game franchise record.
Patriots' Marcus Jones celebrates after his punt return touchdown against the Panthers.

AP Photo/Charles Krupa FOXBOROUGH – Marcus Jones’s appetite for risk, fielding a punt with two Carolina Panthers players within striking distance as he caught it, put the Patriots on the scoreboard and sparked a run of three consecutive touchdowns that put the game out of reach early.

title: Report: Al Horford leaves Celtics for multi-year deal with Warriors
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "Thank you, Boston.
" Al Horford during the Celtics' end-of-season media availability.
Barry Chin/Globe Staff The Celtics’ frontcourt depth has taken another hit.
